title: Soumya rape-murder case: Convict caught hours after escaping jail; was hiding in well
content: Govindachamy, convicted of rape and murder, escaped from Kannur Central Jail in Kerala early Friday morning, prompting a statewide search. Authorities discovered his absence during a routine check of his cell. An internal inquiry has been launched to investigate the circumstances surrounding his escape and determine any security lapses that may have occurred.

title: DRDO successfully tests UAV-Launched Precision Missile ULPGM-V3
content: India has successfully conducted flight trials of the UAV Launched Precision Guided Missile (ULPGM)-V3 in Andhra Pradesh. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded the achievement, emphasizing the Indian industry's readiness to produce critical defence technologies.

title: Watch: Rahul, Priyanka, Dimple tear SIR placards; protest enters fifth day
content: Congress MP and leader of opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, and Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav, along with several MPs from INDIA bloc parties, tore placards with SIR written on them and threw them into a dustbin as part of their demonstration on the Parliament premises.

title: Thailand-Cambodia clash: India issues advisory; lists areas 'not safe to visit'
content: The Indian Embassy in Thailand has advised its citizens to avoid areas near the Thailand-Cambodia border due to ongoing deadly clashes. Fighting has escalated, involving heavy weaponry and resulting in casualties and mass displacement. The Tourism Authority of Thailand has identified specific restricted zones across seven provinces.

title: School building collapses in Rajasthan: 6 dead, 40 children feared trapped
content: A tragic incident occurred in Jhalawar's Piplod village where a government school building collapsed during morning prayer, resulting in the death of six students and injuries to twenty-nine others. Authorities have initiated rescue operations and provided medical assistance. Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed grief and assured support.

title: Microsoft layoffs: CEO Nadella to employees after 9,000 job cuts
content: Satya Nadella addressed Microsoft's significant job cuts, impacting over 15,000 employees, acknowledging the difficulty while emphasizing the necessity for the company's AI transformation. Despite record profits and soaring stock prices, Nadella described the layoffs as part of a dynamic industry shift, requiring Microsoft to adapt and invest heavily in AI infrastructure to meet evolving customer needs.

title: Cricketer Yash Dayal accused of sexually assaulting minor girl at city hotel
content: IPL cricketer Yash Dayal faces a second FIR, this time in Jaipur, alleging repeated sexual assault of a minor in 2023 and again in April. This follows a previous rape complaint filed in Ghaziabad.

title: Robbers in Swiggy, Blinkit uniforms loot jewellery shop in Ghaziabad
content: In a brazen daylight robbery, two individuals disguised as delivery agents targeted Mansi Jewellers in Ghaziabad's Brij Vihar. The robbers, dressed in Swiggy and Blinkit uniforms, stormed the shop, threatened the employee at gunpoint, and stole gold, silver ornaments, and cash worth approximately Rs 30 lakh within six minutes.

title: 'India hard done by weather gods': Ex-cricketer on changing conditions
content: Sanjay Manjrekar expressed concerns over the favorable weather and pitch conditions that aided England on Day 2 of the fourth Test after India's challenging batting stint. England capitalised with a strong opening partnership, reaching 225/2 at stumps. Jonathan Trott noted the advantageous batting conditions for England, while Manjrekar praised Anshul Kamboj's potential despite unfavorable conditions.

title: Intel cuts 24,000 jobs, cancels several factories; CEO admits 'hard but...
content: Intel, under new CEO Lip-Bu Tan, is implementing significant cost-cutting measures, including slashing approximately 24,000 jobs and abandoning major expansion projects in Germany and Poland. The restructuring aims to address recent financial losses and refocus the company on AI chips while regaining market share. These hard decisions are deemed necessary to streamline operations and drive future growth.

title: 'Walking corpses': Photos of malnourished Gaza toddler go viral; see pics inside
content: A Gaza-based photographer captured a viral image revealing extreme hunger among children, highlighting the worsening humanitarian crisis. While famine hasn't been formally declared, UN agencies warn of mass starvation due to restricted aid, a claim Israel denies, blaming Hamas.

title: UP man swings 8-month-old son upside down & roams village
content: In Rampur, a man, enraged over unmet dowry demands of Rs 2 lakh and a car, was filmed holding his eight-month-old son upside down and parading him through the village. The incident, which occurred on July 19, prompted police action for disturbing public peace, despite no formal complaint being filed.

title: 'To protect integrity of electoral rolls': EC to launch SIR nationwide; schedule to be out soon
content: The Election Commission has announced a nationwide Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls to safeguard the integrity of voter lists, citing its constitutional duty. This decision arrives amidst opposition uproar, particularly in Bihar, where concerns about the revision process have been raised.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I’ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: 'How do you break a man who's defeated death?': Ex-cricketer hails Pant's grit
content: Aakash Chopra lauded Rishabh Pant's indomitable spirit after he batted through pain with a fractured toe in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, drawing comparisons to Anil Kumble's legendary resolve. Despite his injury, Pant scored a valuable 54, showcasing immense patriotism and earning widespread respect. Chopra criticised England's tactics but admired Pant's unbreakable determination against all odds.

title: Trump grills Powell to cut rates; spars over Fed renovation costs in rare headquarter visit
content: Donald Trump confronted Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell during a visit to the Fed's headquarters, criticizing renovation cost overruns and reiterating his demand for lower interest rates. Trump, accompanied by White House officials, questioned the $3.1 billion project, a figure Powell disputed.

title: 'War 2' trailer: It's Hrithik Roshan vs Jr. NTR, Kiara Advani and Ashutosh Rana - Watch
content: Hrithik Roshan returns as Kabir in the action-packed trailer of YRF's 'War 2', the sixth installment of the Spy Universe. The trailer showcases intense face-offs with NTR Jr. and Kiara Advani, promising high-octane action and a deeper plot directed by Ayan Mukerji.

title: Mumbai rains: Local trains hit, traffic chokes major roads
content: Mumbai experienced heavy rainfall on Friday. Local train services faced delays. Traffic congestion occurred on major roads. Central Railway reported train delays on Main and Harbour lines. The IMD issued a warning for intense rain in Mumbai, Thane, Raigad, and Pune. Several areas recorded significant rainfall. The Andheri subway closed again due to waterlogging. Commuters are advised to travel cautiously.

title: Class 10 girl jumps from 4th floor: Classmates say they tried to stop her; condition critical
content: A 16-year-old student from Ahmedabad's Som Lalit School is in critical condition after reportedly jumping from the school's fourth floor during recess. Classmates attempted to stop her, but she broke free. She sustained severe head trauma, a concussion, and fractured limbs.

title: Thailand-Cambodia clash intensifies: Heavy weapons, field artillery used; 10 points
content: Escalating violence along the Thailand-Cambodia border has resulted in casualties and mass displacement, prompting international concern. The conflict, rooted in colonial-era border disputes, intensified with deadly attacks and military mobilization. Diplomatic efforts are underway as global powers urge de-escalation and protection of civilians amidst rising tensions and accusations of war crimes.

title: IND vs ENG | Rishabh Pant: The freak who dances to his own tunes
content: Team India's star wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's incredible display of resilience at Old Trafford has become the talk of the town. Despite arriving with a fractured toe and using crutches, Pant defied expectations by batting in the match. Shardul Thakur revealed Pant's early hospital visit and the team's excitement to see him bat.

title: Watch: Main road cut, villagers form man-bridge for kids in flooded Punjab village
content: In Punjab's Moga district, a flash flood washed away a road, leaving school children stranded. Showing remarkable community spirit, villagers formed a human bridge, allowing the children to safely cross the raging waters. Sukhwinder, one of the men involved, downplayed their act of heroism, emphasizing it was a natural response to help those in need.

title: Why did United Airlines ground its fleet? Flight services were delayed nationwide
content: United Airlines temporarily grounded all mainline flights nationwide due to a fire alarm at its Chicago operations center, leading to a precautionary evacuation and a brief service disruption. The FAA issued an advisory, and while no fire was found, over 200 flights experienced delays. Service was restored within an hour, adding to recent operational challenges for the airline.

title: 'Still this sad after 20 years': Linda’s post on Hulk goes viral; details
content: Just days before Hulk Hogan's death, Linda Hogan shared a nostalgic tribute to their 26-year marriage, a post now imbued with unexpected finality. Despite a public split in 2009 and subsequent estrangement, Linda acknowledged both the pain and Hulk's role as a father. Her reflections, a mix of grief and closure, unintentionally became a final farewell to the wrestling icon.

title: 320 million trees die each year from lightning, and climate change is making it worse
content: Lightning strikes kill 320 million trees yearly worldwide. This causes significant carbon emissions, almost matching wildfires. The Amazon and Congo Basin are high-risk zones. Climate change increases lightning frequency, threatening forests in Canada, Russia, and the United States. These silent deaths impact biodiversity and climate stability. The loss equals 8,000 square kilometers of forest, an area larger than Sikkim.

title: Man eats, drinks around pregnant wife's decomposing body after assaulting her
content: In Bengaluru, Shivam allegedly murdered his pregnant wife, Sumana. They married six months ago against their parents' wishes. Shivam, a painter from Uttar Pradesh, suspected infidelity. He assaulted Sumana on Monday night. He found her unresponsive on Tuesday morning. Shivam consumed alcohol and food, then left for work. He discovered her dead on Wednesday and fled.

title: Gold price prediction today: What's the gold rate outlook?
content: Gold price prediction today: Analysts predict continued pressure on gold rates with a bearish near-term outlook. Technical indicators suggest limited upside potential, favoring a 'Sell on Rise' strategy around ₹99,000 with a stop-loss at ₹99,450.

title: 'India need the Virat mentality': Ex-England captain warns Shubman Gill's side
content: As England dominated Day 2 of the fourth Test, Michael Vaughan urged India to display Virat Kohli-like intensity on Day 3, deeming it series-defining. England, trailing by 133 runs, benefited from a strong opening partnership. Vaughan emphasised that an Indian victory on Day 3 would keep the series alive, while a loss would seal England's triumph.

title: 3 years, 14 rounds: Trade deal with UK clinched hours before start of Op Sindoor
content: India's trade deal with the UK, initiated 18 years ago, gained momentum post-Brexit and India's RCEP exit. Reviving dormant talks, the Modi government aimed to tap developed markets like the UK and EU. Boris Johnson's initial push faced setbacks with his resignation, compounded by UK's internal uncertainties and visa concerns.

title: Shubman under fire: 'India "handed" Rishabh Pant's runs back to England'
content: England dominated Day 2 of the fourth Test against India, finishing at 225/2, just 133 runs behind India's 358. A strong 166-run opening partnership between Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley set the stage. Former England captain Nasser Hussain criticized India's bowling and captaincy decisions. For India, Kamboj returned figures of 1/48 from 10 overs, while Jadeja ended the day with 1/37 in 8 overs.

title: 'Business-as-usual' for parties, Dhankhar now marooned in political no man's land
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation as Vice President, ostensibly due to health reasons, has been met with muted reactions from both the government and opposition. Dhankhar's acceptance of an opposition motion against Justice Yashwant Varma triggered a no-confidence threat from the NDA, leading to his swift departure. Political circles are now focused on his replacement, with Dhankhar seemingly isolated after the controversial decision.

title: 'Childlike curiosity ...': Not just Trump, Clinton also sent note to Epstein
content: Bill Clinton sent a birthday letter to Jeffrey Epstein for his 50th birthday in 2003, joining nearly 50 others, including Donald Trump, who also contributed. The messages were compiled by Ghislaine Maxwell into an album. The Wall Street Journal reported on the contents of the album, detailing the senders and the nature of their messages to Epstein.

title: How past FTAs shaped UK deal & how UK agreement will change past pacts
content: India's recent free trade agreements with the UK, Australia, and the UAE are setting precedents for future negotiations. Concessions like reduced auto tariffs and government procurement access are becoming baselines. However, India is resisting pressure to open its agricultural market, particularly dairy, to protect its farmers, potentially impacting existing trade deals with ASEAN, Japan, and South Korea.

title: 'Confident India will …': Piyush Goyal says trade deal talks with US making ‘fantastic’ progress
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has spoken of 'fantastic' progress in India-US trade deal negotiations. Both countries are looking for a mini or interim agreement before the August 1st deadline. India seeks preferential market access, while the US pushes for access to India's agriculture and dairy sectors.

title: Insect-in-food row: Rameshwaram Cafe alleges extortion bid
content: The Rameshwaram Cafe in Bengaluru has filed a police complaint against individuals who allegedly attempted to extort Rs 25 lakh by falsely claiming food contamination at its airport outlet. The group reportedly created a disturbance, alleging an insect was found in the food, and threatened to release a video on social media unless compensated.

title: Mohammed Siraj loses temper at Duckett, umpire forced to step in
content: During the ongoing Test match at Old Trafford, Mohammed Siraj had a tough day, while a heated exchange with Ben Duckett grabbed attention. Duckett scored a rapid 94 before Anshul Kamboj, on debut, claimed his wicket. Earlier, India posted 358, with contributions from Sai Sudharsan, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Rishabh Pant. Ben Stokes led England's bowling attack with a five-wicket haul.

title: IND v ENG: 'Tactically off' - Ponting slams Gill-led India after England's dominant start
content: Former Australian captain Ricky Ponting has heavily criticised India's strategies on Day 2 of the fourth Test against England, particularly their field placements and bowling choices. Ponting questioned Shubman Gill's captaincy after England's openers dominated with a 166-run stand.

title: 'Reckless decision': US hits out at France’s push to recognise Palestinian state
content: The US strongly opposes France's plan to recognize Palestine at the UN, labeling it 'Hamas propaganda.' French President Macron announced the decision, supporting a two-state solution without Hamas, aiming to encourage Arab states to recognize Israel. Netanyahu criticized Macron, while ceasefire talks collapsed, with the US blaming Hamas. International concern grows over Gaza's humanitarian crisis amidst ongoing conflict.

title: Manipur: President's rule extended for six months; effective from August 13
content: President's rule in Manipur, initially imposed on February 13, 2025, following N. Biren Singh's resignation amidst ethnic violence, has been extended for another six months, effective August 13, 2025.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for July 25 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a cautiously optimistic market outlook for July 25, 2025, highlighting Gujarat Pipavav Port Ltd (GPPL) and National Aluminum as top stock picks. Nifty is rangebound, supported by key technical levels, while Bank Nifty consolidates with a bullish undertone.

title: 'Not satisfied': Kamboj reflects on maiden wicket and learning from Bumrah
content: Anshul Kamboj, making his Test debut, provided a crucial breakthrough for India by dismissing Ben Duckett for 94 on Day 2 of the fourth Test. The Haryana pacer's sharp delivery led to his maiden Test wicket, sparking an emotional celebration. Kamboj acknowledged his nerves but expressed a desire to improve, highlighting the invaluable experience of bowling alongside Jasprit Bumrah.

title: Miracle at 30,000 ft: Thai woman delivers baby mid-air; Air India Express crew assists in labour
content: An Air India Express flight from Muscat to Mumbai turned into an unexpected delivery room on Thursday as a Thai passenger went into labor. With no doctor on board, the cabin crew skillfully assisted in the birth of a baby boy. Upon landing, mother and child were hospitalized and are doing well.

title: Can't lower age of consent from 18, govt tells SC
content: The government has informed the Supreme Court that lowering the age of consent from 18 is not feasible, emphasizing its role in safeguarding minors from sexual abuse, often within trusted environments. While advocating for strict enforcement to uphold child protection laws, the Centre acknowledged judicial discretion in adolescent romantic relationships. Data indicates most offenses are by known individuals, making consent a problematic defense.

title: Opposition MPs tear and throw ‘SIR’ posters in bin as symbolic rejection of exercise
content: The MPs also staged a protest march in the Parliament House complex, demanding the rollback as well as a discussion on the issue in both houses

title: Kamal Haasan, MNM chief, takes oath as Rajya Sabha member
content: On June 12, 2025, Kamal Haasan backed by the DMK and its allies was declared elected unopposed to the Rajya Sabha from Tamil Nadu.

title: DRDO successfully tests UAV-launched Precision Guided Missile
content: DRDO has developed a UAV-Launched Missile – Extended Range (ULM-ER) munition designed for deployment via unmanned aerial platforms

title: Rajasthan school roof collapse LIVE: Atleast four students killed, several feared trapped in debris in Jhalawar
content: At least 27 students were studying in the upper primary school in Piplod village when roof of classes for 6 and 7 gave way, says police.

title: Education Ministry permits seven new departments at Central University of Karnataka
content: The V-C said that CUK is establishing a Centre of Excellence in High Frequency Electronics in the campus, which aims at training manpower in high frequency electronics

title: Watch | Gujarat’s collapsing bridges: Cracks in infrastructure and accountability
content: Abhinay Deshpande reports on the tragedy in a State where at least six bridges have collapsed in the last four years

title: Narendra Modi surpasses Indira Gandhi to be PM with second longest unbroken stint
content: Officials noted that Mr. Modi completes 4,078 days in office on Friday (July 25, 2025). Indira Gandhi was in the office in an unbroken stint for 4,077 days, from January 24, 1966 to March 24, 1977

title: Engineered for speed, not safety? The cost of a fast corridor
content: Hyderabad’s Outer Ring Road has seen over 30 deaths in 2025 and 369 in the past five years, with road safety analysts highlighting that most accidents are preventable errors like speeding, poor lane discipline, misuse of road shoulders, and inadequate driver training

title: PM Modi in Maldives LIVE: Modi arrives in Maldives for two-day visit
content: PM Modi has been invited by Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu and will attend the country’s 60th Independence Day celebrations as the Guest of Honour

title: Parliament Monsoon session LIVE updates, Day 5: Lok Sabha adjourned till 2 p.m., Rajya Sabha adjourned till 12 noon
content: While the parliament has hardly seen any business since it reassembled on Monday for the monsoon session, it remains to be seen if the deadlock ends today.

title: Telangana caste survey draws praise of Congress top leadership
content: Telangana Chief Minister Reddy pointed out that the Telangana caste survey was a role model for the country

title: ‘Untainted’ teachers and non-teaching staff left in the lurch, both in Kolkata and Delhi
content: Despite protests and appeals, axed teachers struggle to find justice; both Supreme Court and High Court refuse to interfere in new school recruitment process

title: KITE deploys 2,161 robotic kits in schools in Kerala’s Kannur to boost practical learning in robotics
content: As part of revised ICT curriculum, a chapter in Class 10 textbook introduces students to robotics concepts through practical activities such as circuit construction, the use of sensors and actuators and controlling devices via computer programming

title: APTSL to offer cybersecurity auditing services nationwide
content: Andhra Pradesh Technology Services Limited expands cybersecurity services to private sector and other States, offering internships and awareness programs to combat cyber frauds

title: Citizenship under suspicion | How migrant workers from West Bengal are being detained as Bangladeshi infiltrators
content: Following the recent detention of residents of West Bengal by the Delhi police on suspicion of being illegal Bangladeshi immigrants, The Hindu finds out how an exchange of land parcels between the two neighbouring nations in 2015 is affecting those who opted for Indian citizenship

title: Questions on Siddaramaiah's tenure as CM persist; leaves for Delhi along with DKS
content: The two Karnataka leaders are in New Delhi in their third trip since June, even as an uneasy calm prevails in the State Congress unit where voices from both camps have fallen silent over the CM issue following a high command gag order

title: Rape and murder convict Govindachamy arrested after escape from Kannur jail
content: Govindachamy was found hiding inside a well. He earlier escaped from the jail, prompting a Statewide manhunt

title: Cybercrime police arrest 45 in nationwide crackdown on online fraud
content: Of the 45 persons arrested, 17 were linked to trading fraud schemes, while nine others were apprehended for operating an illegal cybercrime call centre that defrauded citizens in India and the United States

title: In Odisha, crimes against women mount as courts and police falter
content: With a high case load, poor conviction and chargesheeting rates, Odisha’s response to crimes against women is inadequate

title: High alert in Kerala’s Kanhangad after LPG tanker overturns, holiday declared, traffic curbs in place
content: The tanker overturned into a roadside swamp while trying to give way to an oncoming bus on a narrow service road

title: For Karnataka students, the grass is still greener overseas
content: Be it geopolitical tensions, new immigration laws, visa troubles or non-availability of jobs, many students who had gone abroad from Karnataka have returned in the last couple of years. While uncertainty loomed over many of their futures, some have managed to bring their studies and careers back on track after either flying to other countries to complete their education or deciding to find jobs in India, writes Jahnavi T.R.

title: Felt redemption of consciousness, say foreign pilgrims after Amarnath shrine ‘darshan’
content: The six foreigners who visited the cave shrine located at an altitude of around 14000 feet including pilgrims from the United States, Canada and Germany

title: IIT Guwahati team gives bamboo an automobile-ready touch
content: Combined with biodegradable polymers, the fast-growing Bambusa tulda has potential applications in automobiles and packaging, researchers said

title: Global childhood vaccination slowed by pandemic: study
content: The study published in The Lancet highlights the progress and challenges in vaccination efforts across the globe from 1980 to 2023

title: A.P. Governor advocates cultivation of oilseeds, pulses to check malnutrition in country
content: Andhra Pradesh was a leading performer with a Compound Annual Growth Rate of 8.8% in agriculture and allied sectors in 2024-25 fiscal year, says Governor Abdul Nazeer

title: TDP, BJP leaders submit memoranda to CEO on strengthening the electoral process
content: Among others, they suggest that death details be gathered from local bodies at regular interval and voter lists updated accordingly, zero door number system be avoided, and schools / colleges be made voter enrollment hubs

title: IMD issues ‘heavy to very heavy rainfall’ warning for North Coastal Andhra Pradesh till July 27
content: Low-pressure area forms over north Bay of Bengal, and it is likely to become well marked and move towards West Bengal and North Odisha, says IMD

title: Rajasthan considering establishment of “risk relief fund” for farmers
content: The fund is to resolve the financial difficulties faced by them because of high premium charged by crop insurance companies

title: Modi leaves for Maldives after concluding U.K. trip
content: Mr. Modi was hosted by his U.K. counterpart, Keir Starmer for an intense session of talks that also covered regional and global issues of mutual interest

title: Indian students flagged difficulty in obtaining U.S. student visa appointments: Govt to Parliament
content: Govt said the MEA took up the matter with the U.S. Embassy in New Delhi as well as the U.S. Department of State

title: India, U.S. presently engaged in active negotiations on Bilateral Trade Agreement: Govt in Parliament
content: Both sides acknowledged the importance of "maintaining positive momentum" in these negotiations and expressed their commitment to an early conclusion of the first tranche of a mutually beneficial, multi-sector BTA, Govt said

title: Mandatory to immerse Plaster of Paris (PoP) Ganesh idols up to 6 ft in artificial ponds only, says Bombay HC
content: The order will be effective till March next year for the festivals that have the custom of immersing deities’ idols in Maharashtra

title: Operation Sindoor: India's actions were measured, non-escalatory, govt tells Parliament
content: Minster of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh said said Operation Sindoor was launched to respond to a "barbaric cross-border terror attack by Pakistan-sponsored terrorists

title: V.S. Achuthanandan, the man of the masses
content: Had it not been for him, many cases and issues deserving public attention and debate would have easily gone under the carpet

title: Central govt. officials petition Cabinet Secretary, PMO on career stagnation
content: In its appeal to the Prime Minister, forum seeks fresh cadre review, initiation of time-bound promotions, and service parity with other Central Civil Services

title: Stop unlawful deportation of Bengali Muslims, Human Rights Watch tells government
content: To garner political support, BJP-run States have rounded up Muslims, mostly impoverished migrant workers, and turned them over to Indian border security personnel, it says

title: NGO members assaulted in Indore over suspicion of religious conversion
content: Right-wing activists attack Howl Group members during a press conference called by them to counter the “misinformation campaign” against it

title: The NFL's All-Under-Pressure Team: 15 people with something huge on the line in 2025
content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

title: Pro wrestling legend Hulk Hogan dies at age 71
content: Hulk Hogan, an icon in the world of professional wrestling, has died at the age of 71, Florida police and WWE said Thursday.

title: Kansas' Self hospitalized, has 2 stents inserted
content: Kansas coach Bill Self was hospitalized Thursday after experiencing "some concerning symptoms" and had two stents inserted. The school said he was expected to make a full recovery.

title: Raiders releasing Wilkins; NFLPA files grievance
content: The Raiders have informed defensive tackle Christian Wilkins that he has been released. The NFLPA has filed a grievance on his behalf after the $35.2M of guaranteed money left on his contract was voided last month.

title: Mariners land slugging 1B Naylor from D-backs
content: The Mariners bolstered their efforts to return to the playoffs by acquiring slugger Josh Naylor from the Diamondbacks on Thursday night.

title: Rodgers opens with pick: Got it out of the way
content: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said his interception wasn't a bad omen for his Steelers tenure, saying, "I'm going to throw some touchdowns, too," and expressing optimism about the team's Super Bowl hopes.

title: Trump issues executive order for college sports
content: President Donald Trump has directed members of his Cabinet to develop a plan in the next 30 days aimed at preserving college sports opportunities and preventing college athletes from becoming professionals.

title: Hurricanes lock in Blake with 8-year, $45M deal
content: Jackson Blake, coming off a rookie season in which he had 17 goals and 17 assists, signed an eight-year, $45 million contract extension with the Hurricanes.

title: Iamaleava: Left Tennessee to come back home
content: UCLA quarterback Nico Iamaleava said Thursday that his main motivation for transferring this spring was proximity to family, not the money in his NIL deal.

title: 🔮 Latest fantasy football mock draft
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal? Best pick?
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo polled executives and scouts on the incoming rookie class. Who will win ROY? Which players will surpass expectations?

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: McGee's Mascot Power Rankings: The best of the fun and furry in college football
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

title: 'It's 100% addictive': Cowboys coach Schottenheimer reveals the meaning of his tattoos
content: From his "whys" to his "life license plate," Schottenheimer explains his ink and what he'll do if he wins a Super Bowl.

title: We ranked the 50 most impactful NFL offseason moves
content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1?

title: MLB Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

title: Pete Rose history on display at Baseball Hall of Fame
content: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum's archives contain dozens of items related to MLB's hits king.

title: In the wake of tragedy, can Liverpool win a second straight Premier League title?
content: Diogo Jota's death casts an immense shadow over Liverpool's preseason preparations, but new arrivals have strengthened the squad. Could the Reds win the Premier League title again?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Greene to join exclusive club? Luzardo turns it around? Don't be surprised
content: Let's take a look into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Chiefs' Travis Kelce shows out in training camp ahead of 'Happy Gilmore 2' cameo
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end had an impressive Day 2 of training camp before his "Happy Gilmore 2" appearance premieres.

title: No Messi, no Alba: Can the MLS All-Star Game be fixed, and where does it go from here?
content: With some of the league's biggest stars absent, MLS must find a way to boost the profile of the All-Star Game.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: Michelle Agyemang's breakout Euro 2025 has helped England reach the final, but what lessons can she learn from teammates and Spain's young talent?

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: While the top three squads from last week's power rankings remain steady, the Whipsnakes have moved up to the No. 4 spot.

title: 2K details reveal roadmap for NBA 2K26
content: Here's the schedule for all upcoming reveals and announcements for the upcoming basketball simulation.

title: One killed in Jammu shootout
content: The J&K Police has not issued any statement about the incident. Official sources said it took place when the police were chasing suspected drug peddlers in the area

title: Assertions like ‘J&K is illegally occupied’, ‘should separate from India’ attract UAPA sections: J&K High Court
content: The trial court was of the view that since the respondents were merely raising slogans with no activity of inciting violence, “Section 13 was not applicable”

title: The fault lines in India’s electoral architecture are visible
content: The Bihar poll rolls revision only strengthens the point that the Election Commission of India must back alternative models of enrolment

title: Home Minister to move statutory resolution in Parliament to extend President’s Rule in Manipur
content: Shah’s notice was admitted for Thursday but the House was adjourned around 2.15 p.m. following protest by the Opposition against the Election Commission’s SIR process in Bihar

title: When people live in mortal fear of traps set for the wildlife in Kerala
content: Illegal electric snares set up by farmers to ward off wild animals claimed two lives, one a 15-year-old, in the past two months in different parts of Kerala. Farmers are required to seek permission before installing electric traps, but that stipulation is seldom abided by. They just focus on crop protection, using the cheapest option available. Sam Paul A. gives an overall picture

title: Myanmar junta claims recapture of gold mining town, Thabeikkyin
content: A civil war has consumed Myanmar since a 2021 coup deposed the civilian government, with the military battling a myriad of pro-democracy guerrillas and ethnic armed organisations.

title: Collector visits school, dines with students
content: Mr. Lakshmisha enquired with the students about quality of food and explained to them about cyber frauds

title: Honey trap row: BJP Minister questions Sharad Pawar and Eknath Khadse’s connection with the accused
content: Taking to social media, he highlighted that when the Opposition was in power, “they attempted to implicate” him in false crimes

title: SC reserves verdict on State government’s challenge on Kannada actor’s bail
content: The Bench was hearing a plea filed by the State against the High Court’s December 13, 2024 verdict granting bail to Mr. Darshan and co-accused

title: 11th edition of Malabar River Festival to begin in Kozhikode on July 25
content: Competitions to take place on Iruvazhinjipuzha and Chalippuzha; Public Works Minister to inaugurate closing ceremony on July 27, 2025

title: No safety audit yet despite rise in incidents of drowning in Kozhikode
content: Safety and surveillance measures remain ignored near risky waterbodies, public ponds, and water tourism destinations

title: 17 tourists rescued after harrowing night in Odisha Forest
content: They battle heavy rain, pitch darkness, and the chilly wind atop 3,000-foot altitude in Gandhamardhan hill

title: KSRTC launches weekend temple tour package in Bengaluru
content: The one-day pilgrimage circuit, covering 277 km, will be operated on Saturdays and Sundays, using KSRTC’s Ashwamedha Classic buses

title: Utpal Kumar Singh to take over as CEO of Sansad TV
content: Mr. Singh will replace Rajit Punhani, a 1991 IAS officer of Bihar cadre, who was appointed as the CEO of Sansad TV during former Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar’s chairmanship

title: GST notices to traders: A fiasco that could have been avoided with feet on ground
content: Before issuing notices to the traders, a spot visit to assess the nature of business should have been undertaken, say sources

title: Bengali migrants not under attack; Mamata  inciting conflict to garner votes: Mithun Chakraborty
content: This development comes days after Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced a language movement to protest against reported attacks on Bengali-speaking migrant workers

title: Decoding ECI’s counter affidavit on SIR | Explained
content: What has the Election Commission of India argued in its counter affidavit filed in the Supreme Court? Why is seeking a citizenship test through the Special Intensive Revision exercise in Bihar problematic? What are the legal and logistical challenges involved?

title: Telangana caste survey a RARE model for India and Sonia’s letter a Nobel prize: Revanth Reddy
content: The Chief Minister attributed the success to Mr. Gandhi and said that February 4, when the survey started last year, would be celebrated as Social Justice Day in Telangana.

title: Detentions and torture of Bengali migrants increasing: Mamata
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister accused the Union government of spreading “linguistic terror”; she said that from “July 27, a movement will start in Bengal in protest against the attack on Bengalis, Bengali language”

title: ₹375 crore worth tourism projects sanctioned for A.P. in 2024-25: Union Tourism Minister Shekhawat
content: Projects at Suryalanka beach, Borra Caves, Gandikota and Rajamahendravaram get major allocations, Gajendra Singh Shekhawat mentions in a written response in the Rajya Sabha

title: A.P. overdrawing Tungabhadra water, TG tells tribunal
content: Telangana urges Brijesh Kumar Tribunal to allocate savings based on crop water requirement to its in-basin projects

title: Mohan Bhagwat meets Muslims religious leaders in Delhi to promote dialogue between communities
content: Ahmed Ilyasi, chief imam of the All India Imam Organisation (AIIO), said 60 Muslim leaders held a discussion with the RSS chief on ways to ‘end hatred’

title: A writer creates a work, but a translator breathes new life into it, says writer Imayam
content: Mr. Imayam was in conversation with Justice (retired) Prabha Sridevan, former judge of the Madras High Court, who has translated three of his books into English, at The Hindu office in Chennai.

title: Five IAS officers undertake to visit old age homes & orphanages to purge themselves from contempt proceedings before Madras High Court
content: Justice Battu Devanand records the written undertaking given by the officers to spend time with the inmates and arrange lunch/dinner for them out of personal funds

title: Rowdy sheeter murder case transferred to CID
content: According to police sources, the case was transferred due to multiple reasons, including the suspected involvement of influential people

title: Low cancer rate in A.P. prompts govt. to go for another exclusive survey
content: Results of NCD Survey-3 showed that only 0.35% of the screened people were diagnosed cancer, which is low when compared to the incidence of the disease in the country, says Minister for Health, Medical Education and Family Welfare Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Rahul Gandhi granted bail in Savarkar defamation case
content: Rahul Gandhi has also appealed in the Nashik Sessions Court against the issuing of process by the additional chief judicial magistrate. The appeal will be heard next month

title: PM Modi in Maldives: Visit signals reset in ties; what's on the agenda?
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . Divyanka Tripathi’s top 10 gorgeous looks Speak English with ease: 8 essential memory hacks Nidhhi Agerwal's stunning dresses to inspire your wardrobe . how to be one 8 weekend activities to help children build essential life skills Shehnaaz Gill’s Festive Ethnic Looks for Rakhi How .

title: Coldplay scandal: HR chief Kristin Cabot's husband was on a business trip in Japan
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: PM Modi Lands In Maldives For 2-Day Visit: What's On Agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed at Velana International Airport in Male on Friday for a two-day visit to the Maldives. He was received by Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu, amidst traditional song performances and chants of "Vande Mataram".

title: Prosecutor Who Handled US Capitol Attack, Sues Government Over His Firing
content: Michael Gordon prosecuted some of the most notorious members of the mob that attacked the US Capitol on January 6, 2021. His latest case to make is proving that the Justice Department fired him because he was good at his job.

title: Astronomer's Andy Byron, Kristin Cabot's PDA In New Video At Coldplay Concert
content: A new video from a recent Coldplay concert shows former Astronomer CEO Andy Byron embracing HR chief Kristin Cabot moments before they found themselves on the giant screen at the Gillette Stadium in Boston.

title: Ryan Routh, Man Behind Trump's Assassination Attempt In Florida. Here's What To Know
content: A man charged with attempting to assassinate President Donald Trump in South Florida last year was back in court this week, asking a federal judge to let him represent himself, as prosecutors tried to block him from introducing irrelevant evidence.

title: Mumbai Landlord Demands Pending Rs 1.5 Lakh Deposit, Tenant Runs Car Over Him
content: Anil Chavan, a resident of Dombivali, has a house in Baiganwadi, a suburb in Mumbai, which he had rented to Syed Ali against a heavy deposit of Rs 6 lakh.

title: 32,000 Faulty Cameras, 15,000 Missing: Delhi's CCTV Network Under Scrutiny
content: The Delhi government is set to launch a comprehensive technical audit of the city's vast CCTV surveillance network amid growing concerns over faulty implementation and equipment failures in a flagship project initiated by the previous administration.

title: "Nation Comes First": Kargil War Martyr's Wife Sends Son To Military Academy
content: Vinod Kanwar lost her husband at the young age of 20 during the 1999 Kargil war. But the pain did not stop her from sending her only son to join the Indian Army.

title: Opposition Leaders Protest Outside Parliament Against Voter List Revision
content: Opposition MPs, including Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi, protested and raised slogans against the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) being carried out in Bihar.

title: Sundar Pichai's Net Worth Hits $1.1 Billion After Alphabets Market Surge
content: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai, propelled by a rise in the company’s stock and continued investments in artificial intelligence, has reached billionaire status.

title: Minister Faces Non-Bailable Warrant In 2021 Huzurabad Bypoll Code Violation
content: The case was registered in October 2021, accusing Bandi Sanjay of making remarks against an opposing party, alleging they distributed money to voters.

title: In Bed With Satan, Roaming Naked In Desert: Trump Roasted By South Park
content: American animated television series South Park has returned with one of its most provocative episodes to date, taking direct aim at Donald Trump and, by extension, its own network's parent company, Paramount Global.

title: Two Officials Found Responsible For 'Negligence' In Tirupati Stampede Case
content: The report also highlighted that despite the availability of two ambulances, the injured could not be transported efficiently, contributing to the fatalities.

title: Bengal Real Target Of Voter List Revision: Trinamool MP Sagarika Ghose To NDTV
content: The ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls in Bihar ahead of the assembly elections is an "exclusionary and not an inclusionary" exercise, Trinamool Congress MP Sagarika Ghose said.

title: PM Narendra Modi Maldives Visit LIVE: PM Modi Receives Warm Welcome By President Muizzu In Male
content: PM Narendra Modi UK and Maldives Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed in Male on Friday for a two-day Maldives visit.

title: From Tea To Espresso: Coffee Culture Grows In Tea-Loving Nepal
content: The Himalayan country, Nepal, is a major tea producer, as well as a major consumer. Tea is a part of Nepal's culture as rice, a constant presence at homes, meetings and social gatherings.

title: "Another Russia Hoax": Trump Blames Democrats For "Epstein Scam", "Con Job"
content: US President Donald Trump has once blamed "Radical Left Democrats" for the ongoing controversy over the case file related to sex offender and late financier Jeffrey Epstein, calling it a "SCAM" and a "CON JOB."

title: Thane Businessman Duped Of Rs 1.5 Crore By Trio Over Machinery Deal
content: A 60-year-old powerloom owner from Maharashtra's Thane district has alleged that three persons cheated him of Rs 1.5 crore under the pretext of getting new machinery for his unit, an official said on Friday.

title: Ship Turnaround Time At Indian Ports Now Less Than A Day: Minister
content: The Indian ports have significantly improved operational efficiency, with the average turnaround time for ships reduced from 4 days to less than 1 day, outperforming many advanced nations

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas surges into the top 5

Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .

title: Semifinal talking points: Bonmatí's genius, England's luck, too few teams?
